;香港卫生部长周日透露，当局正在考虑要求器官捐献者核实他们的器官担心退出登记的要求异常上升。

;

;卫生局局长卢松茂对与中国大陆拟议的跨境移植机制加倍强调，呼吁人们“造谣和造谣”虚假声明”立即停止。

;

;“我们的好意是使系统成为一个简单的系统，您可以简单地签名并注册，但现在似乎行不通了，”罗在周日的电视采访中说.

;

;“我们希望保证无论居民有没有登记，都会有更多的身份验证……这是我们可以在计算机系统方面改进的地方。”

;

;卫生部长表示，首先必须改进捐献者登记系统，这“非常令人沮丧”，因为登记是居民表达对生命的热爱和尊重的一种方式。

;

;“然而，我们很不幸，少数别有用心的人想要破坏我们的器官捐献系统，”他说。

;

;卫生当局上周透露，香港人的数量异常增加自去年12月政府表示希望建立跨境器官捐献机制以来，申请退出器官捐献名册。

;

;卫生局数据显示，去年12月至4月期间，有5,785名居民申请退出器官捐献名册，但超过一半涉及从未注册或多次尝试退出的人。

;

;等待移植的时间更短？香港考虑跨境器官交换

;

;行政长官李家超上周下令警方调查取走器官的行为，同时严厉谴责他所说的“企图破坏”该系统的人。

;< p>;Lo 周日重申，警方将打击那些散布虚假信息的人，这些虚假信息可能助长了器官捐献浪潮。

;

;“登记或退出器官捐献者名册完全是自愿的，”他说。 “所有的调查都会针对那些造谣和造假的人的行为。”

;

;其中的谣言是，除非他们申请退出，否则居民将被视为器官捐献者，并且人们将被送往中国大陆

;

;香港婴儿 Cleo 在首次跨境器官移植后现在可以独立呼吸

;

;卫生部长表示将推进拟议的跨境移植机制。

;

;“如果我们像您所说的那样暂时停止讨论，那将是我们患者的重大损失，”他补充说。 “真正应该停下来的是那些在网上造谣和造谣的人……我认为他们甚至不应该暂时停下来，他们应该立即停止这样做。”

;

;香港的器官捐献比率是世界上最低的，去年只有 29 人死后捐献器官，23 人捐出肾脏或部分肝脏作为活体捐献者。

;

;香港婴儿的心脏移植点燃了长久的希望-长期跨境计划

;

;根据卫生部门的数据，等待肾移植的患者平均需要等待五年，最长的需要等待29年。需要心脏、肺或肝脏移植的人平均要等两到三年。

;

;另一方面，去年内地捐献的1000多个器官无法匹配到合适的受体。

;美国和沙特阿拉伯呼吁苏丹交战双方延长停火期限

;

;自 4 月中旬以来一直争夺苏丹控制权的苏丹军队和一支敌对的准军事部队上周同意在美国和沙特斡旋下进行为期一周的休战。然而，与之前的其他停火协议一样，停火并没有阻止首都喀土穆和该国其他地方的战斗。

;

;在周日早些时候的联合声明中，美国和沙特阿拉伯呼吁延长停火期限。目前的休战将于周一当地时间晚上 9 点 45 分到期。

;

;“虽然不完美，但延期仍将有助于向苏丹人民提供急需的人道主义援助，”声明说。

;

;声明还敦促苏丹军政府和敌对的快速支援部队继续谈判。

;

;军方与强大的快速支援部队于 4 月中旬爆发战斗。军事总司令阿卜杜勒-法塔赫布尔汉将军和快速支援部队领导人穆罕默德哈姆丹达加洛将军领导了 2021 年的政变，推翻了西方支持的总理阿卜杜拉哈姆杜克政府。

;

;这场战斗使喀土穆和邻近的城市恩图曼成为一个战场。冲突还蔓延到该国其他地方，包括饱受战争蹂躏的达尔富尔地区。

;

;为什么苏丹处于另一场内战的边缘

;

;冲突已造成数百人死亡、受伤数千人，将国家推向崩溃边缘。它迫使超过 130 万人离开家园，前往苏丹境内更安全的地区或邻国。

;

;居民报告说，周日恩图曼部分地区再次发生零星冲突，有人看到军队的飞机飞过该市上空。据报道，北达尔富尔省首府法希尔也发生了战斗。

;

;美国和沙特发表声明的两天前，布尔汉在致联合国秘书长的信中要求联合国驻他国家的特使一位发言人说，联合国秘书长被免职后，对这封信感到“震惊”。

;

;特使沃尔克·佩尔特斯 (Volker Perthes) 一直是苏丹的重要调解人，首先是在该国断断续续地尝试向民主过渡期间，然后是

;

;在布尔汉的信中，珀斯指责交战各方无视战争法，袭击房屋、商店、礼拜场所和水电设施。

;< p>;在上周向联合国安理会作的简报中，Perthes 将这场战争归咎于军方和 RSF 的领导人，称他们选择“在战场上而不是在谈判桌上解决未解决的冲突。”;

;总理纳伦德拉·莫迪 (Narendra Modi) 于周日为印度新议会大楼举行了落成典礼，这是一座现代化的综合建筑这是他的印度民族主义政府改造首都英国殖民时期建筑的宏伟计划的一部分。

;

;就职典礼以及基于印度文化和传统的新德里市中心正在进行的改造在议会选举前一年，莫迪的印度人民党 (BJP) 将展示其强大的印度教民族主义资历及其在过去十年的执政表现，以寻求第三个任期。

;

;早早上，莫迪在大楼外举行了传统的祈祷仪式，内阁高级部长也出席了仪式。然后，他在议会内点亮了一盏传统灯。

;

;该活动遭到 20 个反对党的抵制，他们说莫迪违反了为新大楼举行落成典礼和抢占聚光灯的协议，而这本应由总统来做该国最高行政长官。

;

;“在没有反对派的情况下启用新的议会大楼，并不意味着该国有民主。这是一个不完整的事件。

;

;“印度，而不是印地亚”：在印地语 Diwas 期间围绕印度语言的争论升温

;

;新的议会大楼是一项耗资 24 亿美元的项目的核心，该项目旨在使印度黯然失色殖民时代建筑在首都中心的重要性，为具有鲜明印度特色的现代建筑铺平了道路。

;

;“我们的新议会确实是我们民主的灯塔。它反映了国家丰富的遗产和对未来充满活力的愿望，”莫迪周六晚些时候在推特上说。

;

;这座三角形的议会大楼就在英国建筑师建造的古老圆形遗产建筑对面1927 年，Edwin Lutyens 和 Herbert Baker，印度独立前二十年。

;

;旧议会将被改造成博物馆。

;

;除了现代科技，新议会共有 1,272两个议院的座位比旧建筑多了近 500 个，容纳这个世界上人口最多国家的新立法者的空间至少是旧建筑的三倍。

;

;重建已成为最具争议的城市建筑之一独立以来的项目。有人批评它抹去了新德里跨越一个多世纪的遗产的一部分，莫迪被指责利用它来宣传他执政的印度人民党的印度教民族主义意识形态。

;

;周日的仪式于 140 日举行印度教理论家 Vinayak Damodar Savarkar（俗称 Veer Savarkar）诞辰纪念日。

;

;“莫迪总理为新议会大楼举行的落成典礼标志着他努力将自己确立为新印度领导人的关键时刻印度教民族主义的印度，”驻新德里的政治分析家兼莫迪传记作者尼兰詹·穆霍帕迪耶 (Nilanjan Mukhopadhyay) 说。 “就职典礼是正在进行的象征主义的一部分，目的是摆脱印度的包容性遗产，并采用单一的或印度教的遗产作为印度唯一的过去。”

;

;莫迪政府表示，该项目将有助于满足需求为总理和副总统提供更多办公空间和现代住宅。内政部长阿米特·沙阿 (Amit Shah) 在最近的一次演讲中说，重新开发证明了莫迪“创造一个新印度的愿景，它将现代性与我们的传统和传统相结合”。

;

;去年，莫迪为重新开发的林荫大道揭幕这条大道曾以英国君主乔治五世的名字命名，乔治五世在大道建成时是印度的皇帝。根据伦敦一条类似的主干道，它被称为 Kingsway，后来在 1947 年印度独立后更名为 Rajpath，这是对印地语的粗略翻译。

;

;这条大道现在被称为 Kartavyapath – 或责任之路 – 和莫迪他说，重新命名的决定消除了印度殖民主义的另一个象征。

;

;“奴隶制的象征 Rajpath 从今天开始已成为历史，并被永远抹去，”他当时说。

;

; p>;

;关于新议会是在 2024 年全国大选之前帮助提升莫迪形象的虚荣工程的批评挥之不去。

;

;据报道，新议会的建设耗资 1.45 亿美元。

;

;众议院议席将有 888 个席位，大大超过目前 550 个席位的上限，这表明当局计划大幅增加席位。

;

;路透社、彭博社、通讯社报道法新社

;美国正在对是否继续征收关税采取分析方法美国副贸易代表莎拉·比安奇 (Sarah Bianchi) 表示，中国商品不会将结果建立在美中贸易关系的任何“突破”之上。

;

;周六在美国领导的印度部长级会议上接受采访-太平洋经济框架谈判结束后，比安奇表示，拜登政府并不认为会出现任何此类突破，但会继续与中国在各个层面进行对话。

;

;“我们正在从分析的角度进行审查。比安奇说，作为审查的一部分，我们不认为与中国的贸易关系有任何突破。 “我们不认为那会发生。”

;

;相反，美国贸易代表办公室继续研究行业和利益相关者对关税的评论，并与美国商务部、财政部和其他机构协商，以确定哪些她说，这些类别具有战略意义。

;

;“我们正在研究什么在经济上是合理的，”负责监督美国贸易代表办公室在亚洲的事务的比安奇补充道。

;

;美国前总统唐纳德在“301 条款”调查发现中国盗用美国知识产权并胁迫美国公司转让敏感技术开展业务后，特朗普于 2018 年和 2019 年对当时价值约 3700 亿美元的数千件中国进口商品征收关税.

;

;关税范围从许多消费品的 7.5% 到汽车、工业部件、半导体和其他电子产品的 25%。逃避关税的主要类别包括手机、笔记本电脑和视频游戏机。

;

;1974 年贸易法第 301 条要求在关税首次征收四年后进行审查，审查从最初通知开始2022 年 5 月的步骤。比安奇拒绝透露审查何时完成，但补充说，到 2023 年底这是“合理的”。

;

;美国贸易代表办公室延长了对来自中国的 352 个进口类别的关税排除到 2022 年底再延长 9 个月，现在定于 9 月 30 日到期。华盛顿的一些贸易专家认为该日期可能是关税审查的决定点。

;

;随着审查的进行去年 5 月，由于拜登政府难以遏制高通胀，一些拜登政府官员主张取消部分关税。

;

;美国财政部长珍妮特耶伦表示，取消“非战略性”关税将降低成本对于特定商品，贸易代表 Katherine Tai 辩称关税代表了对中国的“重大影响”。

;

;Bianchi 指出，随着通货膨胀的缓解，与通货膨胀相关的关税讨论已经平息。

;

;中美官员将再次尝试重启贸易谈判

;

;中国商务部长王文涛在底特律与戴锴的会谈中表示反对 301 条款关税是一个令人担忧的问题亚太经济合作组织贸易会议。

;

;前一天，在一系列贸易和国家安全挫折中，王毅与戴和商务部长吉娜雷蒙多的会晤是华盛顿和北京几个月来首次内阁级别的交流，包括美国击落了飞越美国大陆的中国间谍气球。

;

;比安奇说，美国和中国保持健康的对话对全球经济很重要，即使他们不同意。

;

;“这是世界上最大的两个经济体，我们需要在不同层面进行对话，即使是艰难的对话，”她说。

;

;“目前在贸易方面，有有很多相似的观点，”她谈到美国和中国时说。 “我不确定它会走向何方，但我认为对话将继续困难重重，但我认为我们拥有对话很重要。”

;

;

;“如果你决定重返校园，你的最终目标是什么？如果你在入学考试中的尝试没有成功，你最终会浪费大量时间。

;

;“女孩和男孩本质上是不同的。如果你错过了这个特定的阶段，以后可能会更难找到伴侣，”他补充道。

;

;根据中国传统文化，女性应该在 25 岁左右结婚，这是一个

;

;他们二十出头毕业，面临着生活成本上升、结婚费用增加和工作压力增加等诸多挑战，所有这些都构成了满足这一社会需求的障碍

;

;这导致中国的结婚率和生育率大幅下降，单身人口目前已达2.4亿。到 2022 年，该国的总和生育率为 1.175，在全球排名倒数第五。

;

;作为对父亲的回应，这位年轻女性采取了更加独立和现代的立场。

;

;“选择伴侣从来都不是我的人生目标。我的主要目标是个人成长，”她说。

;

;“我非常坚定。在最坏的情况下，我会花一年半的时间准备第二次考试。但花时间去探索不一样的人生体验，难道不值得吗？请不要不断强调我的年龄，并将年龄焦虑强加给我。

;

;“即使到了 100 岁，我也会追求自己的目标，”她补充道。

;

;她在社交媒体就她的困境征求意见，得到了众多回应。

;

;其中，一人提出：“你父亲没有阻止你，而是要你明确自己的目标和追求目标的理由”

;

;另一位说：“女孩们经常被别人提出的简单问题所困，比如‘你明年几岁？’或“毕业后你几岁？”我只能说，跟随你的心。”

;逮捕印度尼西亚的“Crazy Rich Surabayan”突显了机器人交易骗局

;

; h3>;

;Pandey 在完成她的第一个这样的任务后几分钟内就收到了 2,800 卢比（34 美元）——在 Instagram 上关注帐户和点赞一些帖子。又点了几个赞之后，Pandey 投资了 10000 卢比，赚了 15000 卢比。

;

;Pandey 欣喜若狂，不断投入资金，等待更高的回报。

;

;在接下来的 24 小时里，她寄了 90,000 卢比，直到她的账户里一无所有。但是，如果她想取回现金，她的经理继续要求更多的钱。

;

;那时她才意识到她所有的积蓄都被骗了。

;

;她不是

;

;虽然网络犯罪对印度来说并不新鲜，但新一波此类犯罪正在全国范围内迅速蔓延——像 Pandey 这样毫无戒心的受害者，承诺会因喜欢 Instagram 帖子和 YouTube 视频而获得金钱，但现在却被骗了。数百万卢比。

;

;这些罪行使许多人深陷债务之中，而且常常陷入绝望。上个月底，南部城市海得拉巴的一名软件工程师在结婚几个月后因类似计划损失了超过 120 万卢比后自杀了。

;

;据印度国家网络安全协调员 Rajesh 称政府报告此类犯罪的门户网站 Pant 每天收到超过 3,500 份新投诉。独立专家认为真实数字要高得多。

;

;发给印度网络犯罪协调中心首席执行官 Rajesh Kumar 的电子邮件无人回复。马哈拉施特拉邦负责打击网络犯罪的节点官员 Sanjay Shintre 也没有回应媒体询问。

;

;

;

;2014 年上台后，总理纳伦德拉·莫迪 (Narendra Modi) 推出了数字印度“将印度转变为一个数字化社会”的运动，官员们积极推动使用数字支付而不是现金。

;

;但这一优先事项是有代价的。 2014 年，印度报告了 9,600 多起网络犯罪。这一数字继续飙升：根据印度联邦内政部长 Nityanand Rai 去年 12 月在议会发布的数据，2020 年 1 月至 2022 年 12 月期间，记录了超过 160 万起此类犯罪。

;

;根据 FBI 的 2021 年互联网犯罪报告，到 2021 年，印度是世界上网络犯罪记录最多的国家之一，仅次于美国、英国和加拿大。

;

;“容易得多”：QR 码使印度农村成为无现金经济

;

;印度较差的数字素养可能会发挥作用。尽管印度拥有 7.5 亿智能手机用户，但政府数据显示，只有 38% 的家庭具备数字素养，印度政府将数字素养定义为理解和使用计算机、笔记本电脑和智能手机等数字技术的能力。

;

;专家表示，这些骗局虽然很常见，但现在已经到了危险的临界点，新一波骗局邀请人们仅通过在社交媒体上点赞帖子来“赚钱”。

;

;骗子也在使用社交媒体平台说服受害者相信他们的合法性，诈骗任务已经从要求受害者名义上“租用”工业设备以换取可观的租金发展到喜欢在线帖子和在线评级内容。专家认为，当受害者得知他们的“任务”是基于已建立的社交媒体平台时，他们很容易被说服。

;

;东盟规划区域支付网络可以使移民工人受益

;

;根据 Dhanya Menon 的说法，作为一名喀拉拉邦的网络犯罪调查员，这些 Instagram 和 YouTube 骗局“仅在几周前”才曝光，并且由于多种因素而难以被发现。

;

;一个因素是，骗子现在声称来自以下公司：与以前使用虚构公司的策略相比，现实中确实存在，Menon 说。

;

;“这些骗局难以被发现的另一个原因是，众所周知，社交媒体平台上的点赞和观点是，经常被操纵，”梅农说。 “因此，受害者毫无戒心，很容易被引诱。”

;

;在北方邦北部城市菲罗扎巴德，22 岁的 Yash Kumar 表示同意。

;

;2 月今年，刚刚毕业并正在找工作的 Kumar 在 WhatsApp 上收到了一条类似于 Pandey 收到的消息——一份在家工作的工作，他所要做的就是像 YouTube 视频和

;

;“我知道名人和有影响力的人经常使用代理机构来提高他们在社交媒体上的参与度，所以我认为这是此类操作的一部分，”Kumar 说。

;< p>;他被添加到消息应用程序 Telegram 上的一个群组中。 Kumar 投入了 1000 卢比，完成一项任务后赚取了 1300 卢比。为了接下来的任务，他们要求他投资 3,500 卢比，为此他赚了 4,400 卢比。

;

;对资金的需求不断增加。失业的 Kumar 无力资助这件事，所以他向家人和朋友借了钱。他花了 80,000 卢比，意识到自己不能再花了，所以他要求退钱。

;

;“但他们告诉我我的信用评分很低，因此，他们无法退还我的钱，”他说。 “他们还告诉我，如果我付给他们 60,000 卢比，他们可以提高我的信用评分。”

;

;看不到退路，他又借了一些钱并付清了金额。就在他以为自己的噩梦已经结束的时候，骗子又提出了新的要求——Kumar 必须缴纳“取款税”才能退钱。走投无路，走投无路，他又借了一些。

;

;两天时间，他“投资”了278,000卢比，其中大部分是借来的。但诈骗者拒绝付款并阻止了他使用 Telegram。

;

;现在，甚至在他开始他的职业生涯之前，Kumar 就发现自己负债累累，需要一段时间才能偿还。

;

;在西部城市艾哈迈达巴德，罗希特·查尔 (Rohit Chawre) 点击了一条 WhatsApp 消息，承诺给他一份稳定的兼职工作——通过在线电影数据库对电影进行评级。

;

;查尔 (Rohit Chawre) 在一家发电厂，损失超过113万卢比。其中大部分是他从母亲、大家庭成员和朋友那里借来的钱。

;

;负债累累且找工作一事无成，Chawre 从银行贷款以偿还所有未偿债务。

;

;讲英语的菲律宾人被骗到中国骗局：告密者

;

;

;

;Shujaat Dutt（应要求改名），12月损失近25万卢比2021 到网络欺诈，说大多数像他这样的受害者都是“有需要的”。失去亲人后，Dutt 一直在努力组织受害者，并通过 WhatsApp 和 Telegram 支持小组网络提高人们对这些骗局的认识。

;

;“我知道受害者急需钱来治疗他们儿子，或者受害者谁想资助他们女儿的婚姻，”杜特说。 “在某些方面，所有受害者都有他们想要满足的需求。”

;

;印度的人口增长如何在没有中国式控制的情况下放缓

;

;对于 Naresh Modi 来说，这种需求就是孤独

;

;在国家首都新德里，60 岁的退休高管莫迪曾在印度最大的私营公司之一担任高级经理，自从妻子去世后，他一直过着孤独的生活去年九月患癌症。随着他的孩子们在不同的城市定居，莫迪认为打败孤独的方法是兼职职业角色。他认为，他在 4 月初收到的一条 WhatsApp 消息可能正是他所需要的。

;

;他所要做的就是在一个名为 trivagorating.com 的网站上对酒店进行评分，莫迪误以为这是热门的旅行预订门户网站，Trivago。

;

;莫迪在三天内损失了超过 430 万卢比——他全部的退休储蓄。

;

;“我觉得自己被催眠了，”他说。

;中国首架国产窄体客机——C919——成功完成首飞周日的商业航班，这是该国挑战波音-空中客车飞机生产双头垄断的里程碑。

;

;这架由中国东方航空公司运营的标志性编号 MU9191 载有 130 多名乘客，从上海虹桥起飞大约上午 10 点 30 分抵达机场——比预定时间提前了大约 10 分钟。

;

;根据中央电视台的现场直播，该航班于中午 12 点 30 分降落在北京首都机场，受到了水礼的欢迎。< /p>;

;在中国与以美国为首的西方国家展开激烈竞争的同时，中国正寻求减少对外国技术的依赖，经过 16 年的发展，才进行了两小时的商业飞行。

;

;北京一名 14 岁的学生告诉中央电视台，他“很兴奋”能够在下午 2 点 50 分左右搭乘返程航班返回上海。

;

;“这是中国制造的第一架大型飞机，我知道这是有意义，因为我的家人也从事航空业，”他说。 “我必须在这里见证一切，所以我在 2 月份报名了今天的航班，并有机会乘坐回程航班。”

;

;MU9191 也标志着周一开始的上海和上海之间的 C919 定期航班成都，中国西南省份四川省省会。

;

;C919 的主要设计目的是与波音 737 和空中客车 A320 系列单通道飞机竞争，被官方媒体誉为中国国家自主创新的示范技术能力。

;

;中国的C919客机是什么，它能与空客、波音抗衡吗？

;

;由国有的中国商飞公司制造，38.9-据中央电视台报道，这架长 127 米（约 127 英尺）、高 11.95 米的飞机设有 8 个商务舱座位和 156 个经济舱座位。三名飞行员将在机上，飞机将以 0.78 马赫的速度巡航，或大约 955 公里/小时（593 英里/小时），它早些时候说。

;

;首航的特殊机上菜单included claypot rice, mango pudding and chocolate shortbread, as well as White Rabbit Creamy Candy, a milk candy that is an iconic cultural brand of Shanghai.

;

;The C919 had drawn nationwide attention since the announcement of the domestic aircraft development programme in 2007. However, progress had been slow.

;

;In 2014, President Xi Jinping visited the Comac office and called for “relentless” efforts in developing and manufacturing large passenger aircraft, calling them “an important symbol of a country's aviation level and an important sign of its overall strength”.

;

;The following year, the C919 was unveiled to the public and it completed its first test flight in 2017.

;

; In September last year, the C919 was cleared by China's aviation regulator to run commercial passenger operations, with a production certificate following two months later.

;

;In December, the first C919 was delivered to Shanghai-based China Eastern, which later carried out about 200 hours of test flights.

;

;The airline said at the time that four more orders were expected to be delivered within two years.

;

;All C919 jets would be used for domestic flights between major cities such as Beijing, Shanghai, Kunming, Xian, Chengdu, Guangzhou and Shenzhen, it said.

;

;According to CCTV, Comac had received orders for 1,035 C919 jets from 32 customers by the end of last year.

;Hong Kong homemaker Carol Chen Dan-dan beamed with pride when her 11-year-old son and another 12 families praised the lettuce meat wraps and fried lotus roots she had prepared for a Lunar New Year reunion dinner in January at a “neighbourhood kitchen”.

;

;It was the first time Chen, 45, who has barely enough space to cook in her cramped home, introduced cuisine from her hometown Guangdong to her son. The family lives in an 82 sq ft subdivided flat in Sai Wan, one of the districts in Hong Kong clustered with shoebox units notorious for hygiene and security hazards.

;

;“I can only boil noodles and vegetables for my son, at most steaming fish and meat. I rarely prepare deep-fried food as it creates smoke and smells that stick in my home. He always complains about the dull meals,” Chen said.

;

;“He has heard a lot about my childhood food but did not have a chance to taste it … I am very happy as I got recognised by my son and neighbours.”

;

;All that was made possible for subdivided flat tenants such as Chen, with a 3,000 sq ft community space on two floors of a commercial building in Sai Wan, funded by the Jockey Club Healthy Neighbourhood Kitchen Project. The facility also allows residents to use cooking utensils and cycling machines for free.

;

;Hong Kong to open 'community living rooms' for children living in subdivided flats

;

;With the government proposing to launch similar projects this year, welfare groups have voiced hope authorities could be open to different operation models while locating premises and funders to create breathing space for subdivided flat tenants.

;

;The groups hope that the strategy of inviting the business sector or statutory bodies to rent out premises to welfare groups at a low cost or for free would help alleviate poverty.

;

;Benjamin Sin Chiu-hang, senior social work supervisor at the Sai Wan project, said the “extended living space” concept was different from traditional community centres that serve families from all walks of life.

;

;“Subdivided flats are like cancer in a building as they affect the structure and hygiene … The unwelcomed sentiments are passed on to the tenants,” Sin said.

;

;“They often have low self-image and self-doubt in front of other social groups. They dare not use the services … but they can build trust in this space. They won't look down on each other.”

;

;Cap starting rent for subdivided flats, Hong Kong concern group and lawmaker say

;

;Anthony Lai, service development officer at the project, said the facility had also nurtured tenants' healthy lifestyles as they attended fitness classes and prepared meals with ingredients donated by nearby stalls.

;

;“Health talks can only teach them a healthy eating style but they can hardly implement it … The facility has become a practice ground and they can even suggest what they want to do, such as taking the initiative to teach stretching exercises or prepare meals,” Lai said.

;

;The facility also sells medicine at lower costs, while a medical team comprising a nurse, pharmacist, physiotherapist and nutritionist will give health recommendations and follow up on cases of tenants.

;

;In operation since August 2021, the monthly expense of the community space is up to HK$680,000 (US$86,800), with the salary of 14 professionals working there, including social workers, accounting for 70 per cent.

;

;Senior supervisor Sin, acknowledging the cost, said the government did not need to copy the particular model in future projects but could adopt other methods with the same goal. He estimated at least 41 such centres had to be set up in urban districts to provide convenience for residents in the long run.

;

;He urged authorities to link up different sectors to cater to tenant needs, such as food donations for those living in areas with higher commodity prices, or maintenance help for residents of old buildings.

;

;Hong Kong's low-income families cut back on food as electricity rates increase

;

;In Sham Shui Po, also one of Hong Kong's poorest districts, the NGO Society for Community Organisation has three learning centres, where users can rest and borrow computers in open spaces ranging from a few hundred to 3,000 sq ft.

;

;But they often have to give way to training courses in the centre as there are no separate rooms.

;

;Despite hoping to expand and improve the facilities, Sze Lai-shan, the organisation's deputy director, said it did not have the resources.

;

;“It is hard to find big flats. The rent will go up, especially in buildings with lifts. It is difficult to find funding as funders normally prefer donating resources or organising programmes rather than giving out a huge sum of money,” she said.

;

;Sze added that she hoped the government could help NGOs to find premises, such as locating temporary vacant public facilities or venues with lower rent and negotiating with schools to use their halls and home economic rooms.

;

;'I feel so helpless': misery and shame for Hongkongers in subdivided flats

;

;Peace Wong Wo-ping, chief officer of policy research and advocacy at the Hong Kong Council of Social Service, which oversees some 500 welfare groups, said he knew of about six community living spaces targeting subdivided flat tenants in the city.

;

;Wong said it might be hard to find spacious venues for future projects but the government could set up numerous small sites specialising in different services, such as laundry, dining and tutoring.

;

;“It can create space for subdivided flat tenants to interact. Social workers can observe what they need and help to bridge them with public services,” Wong said.

;

;Homemaker Chen thought of leaving Sai Wan last year when her former flat suffered sewage backflow. But she eventually moved to a floor below despite paying an additional HK$1,000, a quarter of her previous monthly rent. The amount accounts for around 80 per cent of the family's only income from government subsidies.

;

;“The atmosphere here is harmonious and happy. We get along well. It is different from other organisations,” Chen said.

;

;“If such centres are near their homes, like a convenient store, everyone will be happy.”

;;2023.05.28 12:00;

;Chinese people perceive international military intervention in Taiwan and confrontation with the United States as the top security threats facing their country besides the pandemic, a domestic study has found.

;

;In general, mainland Chinese citizens were most concerned about the United States which, in their eyes, exerted the greatest impact on their country's security than six other nations and regions mentioned, and respondents most favoured Russia, according to the survey published by the Centre for International Security and Strategy at Tsinghua University.

;

;The centre published a public-opinion poll on the Chinese outlook on international security on Wednesday, in which 74.1 per cent of respondents said security threats against China from “confrontation and conflicts between China and the US” were high or somewhat high.

;

;“It is worth our attention that people in China and the US have negative views about the other country,” institute director Da Wei said, noting that the views were deteriorating along with US-China relations.

;

;The survey data could help policymakers to better assess public sentiment towards security and strike a balance with elites' views while providing a more accurate reference for overseas observers, he said.

;

;The other threats drawing high attention were “international forces' intervention in Taiwan” and the global pandemic, which were both deemed by 72.4 per cent of respondents as high and somewhat high threats against China.

;

;The research institute surveyed 2,661 mainland citizens in November 2022, a time when Covid-19 restrictions were still looming and the same month Chinese President Xi Jinping and US President Joe Biden met for the first time in Biden's presidency, in hopes to repair fractured communications.

;

;Bilateral ties have been hitting low points since the China-US trade war began in 2018, with mounting tensions in the South China Sea and Taiwan Strait.

;

;Along with an intensified Chinese military build-up in the region, there have been increasing fears of armed conflict in relation to Taiwan, which Beijing regards as a renegade province, to be brought under mainland control.

;

;Most countries, including the US, do not recognise Taiwan as an independent state, although Washington opposes the use of force to change the status quo.

;

;Da, the leading researcher, was surprised by finding that China's public remained generally positive about international security changes, with more than half thinking the world would become safer in five years' time.

;

;“This has contrasted quite largely with my personal expectation … but higher educated respondents also showed less sense of security, which might imply that those accessing more information or overseas experience have more direct understanding of insecurity,” he said.

;

;China, US exchange barbs at 'candid trade talks', vow to manage rising tensions

;

;But attitudes towards the direction of US-China relations are more ambivalent. While about 45 per cent believed the situation would improve, about 30 per cent did not expect change. About 25 per cent said the relationship would deteriorate.

;

;The online responses were collected randomly from population subgroups whose sex, age, region and census register (urban or rural) proportionally reflect the latest national census.

;

;More than half the respondents said at the time the US had a “great” impact on China's security, about triple the figure for Russia or Japan, the second and third countries reported by respondents to have the most impact on China.

;

;The US is also the least favoured country among the respondents, with almost 60 per cent of Chinese surveyed describing it as “unfavourable”, contrasting with the most favoured country, Russia, of which about 8 per cent of respondents said was “unfavourable”.

;

;Da said the result was “unsurprising” and echoed opinion polls in the US which show a worsening impression of China among Americans.

;

;According to an annual poll by the Washington-based Pew Research Centre, unfavourable views towards China hit a record 83 per cent of respondents in 2023.

;

;In the Chinese survey, 36 per cent thought the US-China tensions were mainly because of “US factors only”, in contrast with the slight 2.6 per cent who said the issues were caused by “China factors only”, with the rest believing the major factors were “conflicting interests between China and the US”, “different ideologies” and “lack of mutual trust”.

;

;'Pit of fire': Chinese envoy's remark to Japan over Taiwan policy slammed

;

;Among seven countries or regions – including India, South Korea, the European Union and Southeast Asia – the Chinese respondents' impression of Japan had a similar pattern as that of the US.

;

;Some 57.5 per cent of respondents described their impression of Japan as somewhat unfavourable or very unfavourable compared with 59.1 per cent giving the same negative impression of the US.

;

;China and Japan historically have had a strained relationship, largely stemming from the Japanese occupation of World War II and territorial disputes over the Senkaku Islands, known in China as the Diaoyus. But Tokyo's recent push for greater security cooperation with the US, as well as its increased military expenditure, have heightened Chinese concerns.

;

;On the war in Ukraine, 80.1 per cent of Chinese respondents believed the US and Western countries were “most accountable”, followed by Ukraine (11.7 per cent), and Russia (8.2 per cent).

;Japan's most powerful entertainment agency is facing growing scrutiny over its founder's alleged sexual abuse of teenage boys, in a scandal that has prompted questions over the firm's influence and whether media silence had allowed the issue to fester for decades.

;

;Pressure is mounting on Julie Keiko Fujishima, head of Johnny & Associates and niece of its late founder Johnny Kitagawa, after a former pop idol last month lifted the lid on his experience at the label.

;

;Kitagawa had made an indelible mark on Japan's pop industry, shaping its growth over decades with a stable of wildly popular boy bands that included SMAP, Arashi, Hikaru Genji and Sexy Zone. But behind the bright lights of success lay what insiders say was a dark industry secret – that Kitagawa was an alleged predator who not only coerced boys into sex acts for years but wielded his power and influence to diminish reports of his behaviour.

;

;Fujishima earlier this month expressed her “deepest apologies” to those who had asserted they were victims, but said it was impossible to verify the claims, given that Kitagawa had died in 2019. “It is not easy to say in one word whether we recognise it as a fact or not,” she said.

;

;Her minute-long video statement came after Japanese-Brazilian singer Kauan Okamoto, 26, claimed the music mogul sexually assaulted him on as many as 20 occasions in the four years before he left the agency in 2016.

;

;Okamoto believed that most of the agency's “100 to 200” boy-band trainees at the time would have been abused by Kitagawa, who regularly invited them to his house. “I think everyone should speak out, it's probably a shocking number of people,” he said at a press conference on April 12 hosted by the Foreign Correspondents' Club of Japan.

;

;The former member of Antime said he decided to come forward after the BBC released a documentary in March, titled Predator, that detailed allegations against Kitagawa going back to the 1960s. The investigation claimed that Kitagawa had forced himself on as many as 200 boys who had joined the agency dreaming of stardom and feared that speaking up would have ended their prospects in the lucrative J-pop industry.

;

;Okamoto's testimony has also convinced more young men to share their experiences.

;

;After raising the allegations, Okamoto took part in a Diet panel hearing, where he was joined by another alleged victim, actor and dancer Yasushi Hashida.

;

;The pair were asked what measures could be taken to ensure a similar situation would not happen again, with Hashida, 37, suggesting revisions to the law on child abuse and making sure that the law was enforced.

;

;Former singer Ryu Takahashi told the Asahi newspaper on May 15 that he had fought off Kitagawa's sexual advances as a boy and described Fujishima's comments as “an act of desperation”.

;

;Takahashi, 31, also dismissed Fujishima's claim that she knew nothing about the abuse, which was widely rumoured in the industry for decades. The same allegations were aired in court in 1999, he added, after which it would have been impossible for the company or domestic media to not know about the claims.

;

;Japan sees few recruits as low pay, sex abuse claims give military bad image

;

;On Friday, Fujishima announced that the company would take remedial steps, including asking a panel of independent experts to suggest policies to prevent a recurrence of such claims.

;

;But even as Johnny & Associates' crisis grows, it remains to be seen if the scandal would lead to any consequences.

;

;Japanese media outlet ENCOUNT reported that the agency was exploring the option of removing “Johnny” from the company name in an effort to distance itself from the allegations surrounding Kitagawa.

;

;Johnny & Associates has dominated the music scene for generations and still represents many of Japan's top boy bands today, including Arashi and Hey Say Jump, whose popularity shows no signs of declining in the world's second-largest market for recorded music.

;

;The growing controversy has prompted a reckoning by at least two large newspapers, which acknowledged the Japanese media's past coverage on Kitagawa had been lacking.

;

;The Mainichi newspaper in a May 16 editorial said: “The media must reflect on whether they have dealt with this grave problem properly.”

;

;A similar editorial in the Sankei Shimbun said: “Major newspapers and television networks, including the Sankei Shimbun, have largely remained silent on this issue. But now, this 'abnormality' is coming under intense pressure.”

;

;Some critics have suggested that Japanese media conglomerates' heavy reliance on Johnny & Associates' acts to sell newspapers or promote evening entertainment shows may have deterred them from being critical of Kitagawa.

;

;“When my magazine first printed the allegations against Kitagawa back in 1999, the rest of the Japanese media just ignored the story,” said Shiro Saito, a journalist with the Shukan Bunshun weekly news magazine, which ran a series of reports quoting 10 teenage talents who were allegedly abused by the mogul.

;

;Kitagawa sued the magazine for libel and won some US$10,000 in damages for one claim in the series, that his agency had supplied alcohol and cigarettes to minors.

;

;The court declared that the reports of sexual abuse had “validity”, but as none of the boys filed a formal police complaint, Kitagawa walked free.

;

;Meanwhile, others have questioned if Japanese society is prepared to treat sexual assault seriously.

;

;Japanese journalist Takao Yamada, writing in a column in the Mainichi newspaper about the scandal, quoted a colleague on the sex-crimes beat as suggesting: “Rather than it being hard to write about them, the fact is that few people see them as a problem.”

;

;Saito said: “I think the atmosphere is changing, although only gradually. They are reporting about the sexual abuse and they are finally saying that it was terrible, but they are not really going as far as admitting that they knew, that they did not speak up and that if they had acted then, maybe the abuse would have stopped many years earlier.”

;

;Haruko Watanabe, a veteran Tokyo-based journalist, is less than optimistic that the Japanese media's newfound interest in covering a story that has been under its noses for decades would last very long.

;

;“Japanese reporters are salarymen, not journalists,” she said, using the term disparagingly. “The only real journalists in Japan today are the Bunshun reporters who initially broke this story.”
